gurmukhi: ਅਧਿਅਾਤਮ ਕਰਮ ਪਰਮਾਤਮ ਪਰਮ ਪਦ ਤਤ ਮਿਲਿ ਤਤਹਿ ਪਰਮਤਤ ਵਾਸੀ ਹੈ
transliteration: Adhiaatam Karam Paramaatam Param Pada , Tat Mili Tatahi Paramatat Vaasee Hai ?
translation: A rare Guru-conscious person attains the knowledge of spirituality through spiritual deeds and absorbs himself in Him as truth rejoins with Truth.

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਬਿਬੇਕ ਟੇਕ ੲੇਕ ਹੀ ਅਨੇਕ ਮੇਕ ਜੰਤ੍ਰ ਧੁਨਿ ਰਾਗ ਨਾਦ ਅਨਭੈ ਅਭਿਅਾਸੀ ਹੈ
transliteration: Sabad Bibayk Tayk Ayk Hee Anayk Mayka , Jantr Dhouni Raag Naad Anabhai Abhiaasee Hai ?
translation: As musical instruments produce melodious notes which also represent words in a song, so does a meditation practitioner merges in the fearless Lord who pervades in all and sundry.

gurmukhi: ਦਰਸ ਧਿਅਾਨ ੳੁਨਮਾਨ ਪ੍ਰਾਨਪਤਿ ਅਬਿਗਤਿ ਗਤਿ ਅਤਿ ਅਲਖ ਬਿਲਾਸੀ ਹੈ
transliteration: Daras Dhiaan Ounamaan Praanapati , Abigati Gati Ati Alakh Bilaasee Hai ?
translation: As meditation renders all our breaths one with Lord- the granter of life, so would a Guru-conscious man be engrossed in Him by contemplating on Him and becomes capable of enjoying all His bliss by this union with Him.

gurmukhi: ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਕਟਾਛ ਦਿਬਿ ਦੇਹ ਕੈ ਬਿਦੇਹ ਭੲੇ ਜੀਵਨ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਕੋੳੂ ਬਿਰਲੋ ੳੁਦਾਸੀ ਹੈ ||੧੧੬||
transliteration: Anmrit Kataachh Dibi Dayh Kai Bidayh Bhaay , Jeevan Moukati Kooo Biralo Udaasee Hai ?116?
translation: By the elixir-like divine glance of the True Guru, he becomes unconscious of his body (needs). Such a person with renounced and detached inclination is rare to come by. (116)
